title: Buggy and useless
text:
After a month of fighting to get two Omni S2 speakers to work as a surround pair to my Omni bar (which sounds amazing), I decided to surrender and return the two rear speakers because of the buggy WiFi implementation that has made so many customers very mad. Years of customer complains and Polk seems incapable of fixing it! What a shame....the system does sound great...

Like many others, it takes me hours to get the speakers connected and to create a surround group. Then, for no apparent reason, both rear speakers disconnect from the WiFi (sometimes a couple of hours later) and it takes HOURS to get it to work again. So frustrating! This issues have been reported since 2014... yes, 2014!

I feel bad for the sound engineering team at Polk Audio, who managed to create such a good sound product just to see the system fail in the market due to incompetence by the software team.

text:
I have the Polk wireless system throughout my home.   There is no control for the subwoofer which is set very high.  I have to keep it shut off for just music and only turn it on for movies. Everything shows that music is playing but there is no sound.  Support for the system is basically non-existent and I just wait for rare updates.  The Polk wireless system is so close to being a good one but I wonder if the company has just moved on to something else shiny.  Oh, and my son moved to Germany and can control my system from there!

Last update ruined the system for me.   I‚Äôm $2000 in with no usable music system at all and no support.   Don‚Äôt buy Polk until they start supporting their product.

title: In polk I trust
text:
To recent reviewer that said "it should allow bluetooth from the phone to the speaker" 

No, it shouldn't. You should/have buy/bought a Bluetooth speaker for that. And then u can easily enjoy your music in ultra-crappy low bandwidth/low quality in exchange for a simple direct connection that was designed for keyboards and headsets/headphones at best. Def not meant for hi quality speaker hardware like the omni. Its a total waste and akin to buying a 2 seat porsche coupe and removing the engine and replacing with 2 rows of bench seats and a battery pack. And telling porsche they should have made it more economical and family friendly.  Should have just bought a Prius or a minivan instead. Cheaper and designed for your needs and intents. 

The rest of us intentionally bought this instead, to hear our music in hi quality/hi bandwidth over wifi/network instead. 

Yes network audio is sometimes more work than it should be but good things and new tech both always require more time and energy to get right and perfect. 

BT is def welcome by me as an alternative for when wifi/LAN not available, but should not be the default/main form of connection. Not for these speakers anyway, they sound great especially in hi res mode. More power than u expect, much better than sonos play 1 and slightly better than heos 1

Add in the fact that the S2 can be had with a rechargeable battery and still cost less than the competition and u have a winner, ESPECIALLY if they continue to improve the music services/software/connectivity going forward
